classes.name: WetWellControlSystem

methods.name: provideSafetyAndProtection
methods.description: Provides safety and protection for operators, maintenance personnel, and the public

methods.name: monitorLiquidLevel
methods.description: Monitors the current liquid level in the wet well

methods.name: reportLiquidLevel
methods.description: Reports the monitored liquid level

methods.name: monitorPumpState
methods.description: Monitors the running state of each pump

methods.name: reportPumpState
methods.description: Reports the state of a given pump

methods.name: switchPump
methods.description: Switches a submersible pump on or off

methods.name: activateAlarm
methods.description: Activates both visible and audible alarms

methods.name: monitorUnauthorizedEntry
methods.description: Monitors the wet well site for unauthorized entry or trespass

methods.name: monitorEnvironmentalConditions
methods.description: Monitors environmental conditions within the wet well

methods.name: monitorPumpCondition
methods.description: Monitors each pump for moisture and excessive temperature

methods.name: recordOperationalParameters
methods.description: Records real-time operational parameters

methods.name: displayOperationalParameters
methods.description: Displays real-time and historical operational parameters

methods.name: provideAutomatedOperation
methods.description: Provides automated operation of the wet well system

methods.name: provideManualOverrideOperation
methods.description: Provides local manual override operation

methods.name: provideObservationalOperation
methods.description: Provides local observational operation

classes.description: Overall system responsible for safety, monitoring, control, and reporting of the wet well

methods.name: startPumpMotor

methods.name: stopPumpMotor

methods.name: trackMotorAvailability
methods.description: Tracks whether each pump motor is available to run

methods.name: startAlternativeMotor
methods.description: Starts an alternative pump if the requested one is unavailable

methods.name: equalizeRunTimes
methods.description: Ensures run times are equalized among all pump motors

methods.name: notifyMoistureDetected

methods.name: notifyOverheatDetected
methods.description: Handles notification when a pump motor overheats

methods.name: shutdownOverheatedMotor

relationships.description: Control system contains a pump control unit
Control system manages one or more submersible pumps
Control system uses a float switch to measure liquid depth and control pumps
Control system monitors the access door for unauthorized entry
Control system includes a display panel for operators
Control system includes alarm notification capabilities
Each pump is equipped with a moisture sensor
Pump control unit manages multiple pumps
Pump control unit uses level switches to determine when to start pumps
Float switch sets pump states on pumps based on liquid depth

domain_model.plantuml:
@startuml
class WetWellControlSystem {
  +provideSafetyAndProtection(): void
  +monitorLiquidLevel(): double
  +reportLiquidLevel(level: double): void
  +monitorPumpState(): void
  +reportPumpState(pump: SubmersiblePump): void
  +switchPump(pump: SubmersiblePump, state: boolean): void
  +activateAlarm(): void
  +monitorUnauthorizedEntry(): void
  +monitorEnvironmentalConditions(): void
  +monitorPumpCondition(pump: SubmersiblePump): void
  +recordOperationalParameters(): void
  +displayOperationalParameters(): void
  +provideAutomatedOperation(): void
  +provideManualOverrideOperation(): void
  +provideObservationalOperation(): void
}

class PumpControlUnit {
  +startPumpMotor(pump: SubmersiblePump): void
  +stopPumpMotor(pump: SubmersiblePump): void
  +trackMotorRunningState(): void
  +trackMotorAvailability(): void
  +startAlternativeMotor(requestedPump: SubmersiblePump): void
  +equalizeRunTimes(): void
  +notifyMoistureDetected(pump: SubmersiblePump): void
  +notifyOverheatDetected(pump: SubmersiblePump): void
  +shutdownOverheatedMotor(pump: SubmersiblePump): void
}

class SubmersiblePump {
  -isRunning: boolean
  -isAvailable: boolean
  -hasSealFailure: boolean
  -isOverheated: boolean
}

class MoistureSensor {
  +detectSealFailure(): boolean
}

class FloatSwitch {
  -leadPumpDepth: double
  -lagPumpDepth: double
  -allowableHighLiquidDepth: double
  +determineDepth(): double
  +setPumpStates(pumps: List<SubmersiblePump>): void
  +setAlarmState(): void
}

class AccessDoorSensor {
  -isOpen: boolean
  +determineDoorState(): boolean
}

class LevelSwitch {
  +indicatePumpStart(): boolean
}

class ControlDisplayPanel {
  -depthInFeet: double
}

class Alarm {
  +activateVisible(): void
  +activateAudible(): void
}

WetWellControlSystem *-- PumpControlUnit
WetWellControlSystem *-- 1..* SubmersiblePump
WetWellControlSystem *-- FloatSwitch
WetWellControlSystem *-- AccessDoorSensor
WetWellControlSystem *-- ControlDisplayPanel
WetWellControlSystem *-- Alarm
SubmersiblePump *-- MoistureSensor
PumpControlUnit --> 0..* SubmersiblePump : manages
PumpControlUnit --> 0..* LevelSwitch : uses
FloatSwitch --> 0..* SubmersiblePump
@enduml

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The design of the wet well control system shall provide for the safety and protection of pumping station operators, maintenance personnel, and the public from hazards that may result from its operation.

issues.description: The requirement is vague about which specific hazards (e.g., electrical shock, mechanical injury, overflow, toxic gases) must be addressed and what safety measures are required.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify or categorize specific hazards and required safety mechanisms, referencing applicable safety standards or metrics.

issues.description: There are no defined acceptance criteria, measurable safety objectives, or test scenarios, making compliance verification impossible.
issues.suggested_fix: Define measurable safety metrics (e.g., safety integrity level, response times), acceptance criteria, and test procedures to verify protection mechanisms.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The control system shall be responsible for monitoring and reporting the level of liquid in the wet well.

issues.description: Measurement details such as units, resolution, accuracy tolerances, and acceptable error margins are not specified.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the measurement units (e.g., feet), required resolution and accuracy (e.g., ±0.1 feet), and acceptable error margins.

issues.description: Reporting mechanism, frequency, format, and recipients for liquid level data are undefined.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify how, where (e.g., display panel, remote system), and at what frequency level data is reported, as well as its format and recipients.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The control system shall be responsible for monitoring and reporting the state of each pump and whether it is currently running or not.

issues.description: The mechanism for reporting pump state (e.g., UI, log file, alert) and reporting frequency are not defined.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify how and where the pump state is reported and at what intervals or on what triggering events.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The control system shall activate a visual and audible alarm when a hazardous condition exists.

issues.description: The term 'hazardous condition' is not defined; specific conditions that should trigger the alarm are unclear.
issues.suggested_fix: Enumerate the hazardous conditions (e.g., overfill, seal failure, unauthorized entry) that must trigger the alarm.

issues.description: Alarm activation requirements for hazardous conditions overlap with other alarm requirements (e.g., REQ-017, REQ-027).
issues.suggested_fix: Consolidate alarm activation requirements into a unified specification to avoid duplication.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The control system shall switch each submersible pump on or off in a timely fashion depending on the level of liquid within the wet well.

issues.description: The phrase 'timely fashion' lacks a specific time bound or performance criterion.
issues.suggested_fix: Define the maximum response time between level threshold detection and pump switching (e.g., within 5 seconds).

issues.description: It is unclear whether pump switching is performed by the float switch, WetWellControlSystem, or PumpControlUnit, creating conflicting responsibilities.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the responsibilities of each component for pump switching and update the domain model accordingly.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Should a seal failure be detected, the pump shall be turned off and an alarm state set.

issues.description: The sequence of actions and responsible components for pump shutdown and alarm activation on seal failure are undefined.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the sequence of actions and designate the responsible components for shutdown and alarm activation.

issues.description: No test criteria or scenarios are provided to verify that the pump is turned off and the alarm state is set on seal failure.
issues.suggested_fix: Define test scenarios and expected outcomes for seal-failure detection and response.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The float switch (a mercury switch) shall determine the depth of liquid within the wet well and set the on or off state for each pump.

issues.description: This requirement assigns pump control to the float switch, conflicting with requirements that assign pump switching to the control system or pump control unit.
issues.suggested_fix: Establish a clear control hierarchy: the float switch provides input and the control system or pump control unit makes the pump on/off decisions.

issues.description: Specifying the use of a mercury float switch poses environmental and safety concerns and may violate regulations.
issues.suggested_fix: Consider using alternative level sensing technologies (e.g., electronic float switches).

issues.description: Inconsistent terminology between 'float switch' and 'level switches' in other requirements causes confusion.
issues.suggested_fix: Adopt consistent terminology for level sensing devices or clearly differentiate their roles.

issues.description: Details on pump identification (e.g., lead/lag ordering) and the number of pumps are not specified.
issues.suggested_fix: Define pump identifiers, ordering, and threshold mappings for each pump.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The access door sensor shall determine the state, opened or closed, of the wet well access door.

issues.description: The sensor’s detection mechanism (e.g., circuit open/closed) is not defined.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the sensing technology (e.g., broken circuit detection) and expected detection behavior.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The wet well control system shall provide automated operation of the site.

issues.description: The term 'automated operation' is undefined; the specific functions to be automated and their operating conditions are unclear.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the automated behaviors (e.g., auto start/stop pumps based on thresholds) and under what conditions they occur.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The wet well control system shall provide local manual override operation.

issues.description: Undefined scope of manual override—what operations can be overridden and how (UI, hardware switches) is not specified.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify which operations are subject to manual override and the user interface or hardware controls for override functionality.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The wet well control system shall provide local observational operation.

issues.description: The term 'local observational operation' is undefined—what parameters can be observed and how this mode differs from automated or manual modes.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the observable parameters (e.g., pump states, liquid levels, alarms) and the interface for observational operation (e.g., display panel indicators).

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The pump control unit shall start the submersible pump motors to prevent the wet well from running over and stop the pump motors before the wet well runs dry.

issues.description: High-water ('running over') and low-water ('runs dry') level thresholds are undefined, so pump activation and deactivation points cannot be determined.
issues.suggested_fix: Define specific high- and low-liquid level thresholds (e.g., in feet) for pump start and stop actions.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The pump control unit shall keep track of whether or not each motor is available to run.

issues.description: Criteria for determining pump availability (e.g., maintenance mode, overheated, seal failure, manual override) are not defined.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the conditions under which a pump is considered unavailable.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: If a pump motor is not available to run and a request has been made for the pump motor to start, an alternative motor shall be started in its place.

issues.description: Criteria for selecting an alternative pump motor when the requested motor is unavailable are not specified.
issues.suggested_fix: Define selection criteria for alternative motors (e.g., next available pump, least-used pump).

requirement_issues.requirement_text: An alarm state shall be set when the high water level is reached.

issues.description: The 'alarm state' triggered at high water level is undefined and overlaps with general alarm requirements (e.g., REQ-004, REQ-027).
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify components of the alarm state (flag, audible alert, visual indicator) and consolidate related alarm requirements.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The pump control unit shall ensure that the starting and stopping of the pump motors equalizes the run times among the motors.

issues.description: No defined algorithm, tolerance, or method for measuring and enforcing run-time equalization among pump motors.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the equalization strategy, acceptable run-time variance, and method for tracking and balancing motor run times.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Level switches shall be used to indicate when pump motors should be started.

issues.description: Inconsistent terminology between 'level switches' and 'float switch' creates confusion over whether these are the same or different devices.
issues.suggested_fix: Adopt consistent terminology throughout or clarify if multiple switch types are in use.

issues.description: Depth threshold values for each level switch and their mapping to specific pumps are not defined.
issues.suggested_fix: Define the depth thresholds for each level switch and map them to the corresponding pump activation logic.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The pump control unit shall be notified if excess moisture is detected in a pump motor.

issues.description: Notification mechanism (event-driven vs. polling) and maximum notification latency for moisture detection are unspecified.
issues.suggested_fix: Define the notification method and maximum allowed latency for moisture detection alerts.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The pump control unit shall be notified if a pump motor overheats and shall shut down the overheated motor.

issues.description: No temperature sensor specification, placement, or overheat threshold is defined for detecting and responding to pump motor overheating.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the temperature sensor type, its placement, and overheat threshold values for shutdown.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The control system shall monitor the pumping site for unauthorized entry or trespass.

issues.description: Unauthorized entry detection methods (e.g., door sensors, motion detectors) are not specified.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the sensors and detection techniques required for unauthorized entry monitoring.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The control system shall monitor the environmental conditions within the wet well.

issues.description: Environmental conditions to be monitored (e.g., gas levels, humidity, temperature) are not specified.
issues.suggested_fix: Define the environmental parameters to monitor and the corresponding sensor requirements and acceptable ranges.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The control system shall monitor the physical condition of each pump for the existence of moisture and excessive temperatures.

issues.description: Temperature sensing for pump condition monitoring is undefined and lacks threshold values.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the temperature sensor type, placement, sampling methods, and overheat thresholds.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The control system shall record and display real-time and historical operational parameters.

issues.description: The specific operational parameters to record (e.g., level, pump states, alarms), data retention policies, and display requirements are unspecified.
issues.suggested_fix: Define the list of parameters, data retention period and policies, and historical data display format and interface.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Indicator lights shall be provided for pump running state, pump seal failure state, pump high temperature failure state, and high wet well level alarm state.

issues.description: The term 'indicator lights' may refer to the same or different features as 'visible alarms' mentioned elsewhere.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify whether indicator lights and visible alarms are the same feature or distinct, and align terminology.

issues.description: Details such as the number of lights, color-coding, layout, and labeling for each indicator are not provided.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the color, label, number, and panel location for each indicator light.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Monitor and detect prohibited entry to the wet well through the access door by way of a broken electrical circuit. Both audible and visible alarms shall be activated.

issues.description: Detection via a broken electrical circuit may not cover all unauthorized entry scenarios (e.g., door left open).
issues.suggested_fix: Consider additional detection methods such as door position sensors to cover all entry scenarios.

issues.description: Terminology ('prohibited entry') differs from other requirements ('unauthorized entry'), leading to redundancy.
issues.suggested_fix: Use consistent terminology and consolidate overlapping entry detection requirements.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Monitor and detect occurrence of a pump motor seal leak. If a leak is detected, both audible and visible alarms shall be activated.

issues.description: Terminology ('seal leak') differs from 'seal failure' used in other requirements.
issues.suggested_fix: Use consistent terminology (either 'seal leak' or 'seal failure') throughout.

issues.description: Duplicate seal failure alarm functionality across multiple requirements (e.g., REQ-007 and REQ-030).
issues.suggested_fix: Consolidate seal failure detection and alarm requirements into a single entry.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: When the depth of liquid is equal to or greater than the lead pump depth, the float switch shall set a state which causes the first pump to turn on.

issues.description: Definition of 'lead pump' ordering and pump identification is missing, so threshold logic cannot be mapped.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify pump identifiers and ordering so the float switch logic can map thresholds to the correct pump.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: When the depth of liquid is equal to or greater than the lag pump depth, the float switch shall set a state which causes the second pump to turn on.

issues.description: Definition of 'lag pump' ordering and handling of additional pumps beyond the second is not provided.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify pump ordering and logic for managing multiple lag pumps if more than two pumps are installed.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: When the depth of liquid is equal to or greater than the allowable high liquid depth, the float switch shall set an alarm state.

issues.description: The 'alarm state' set by the float switch at high liquid depth is undefined and may overlap with other alarm requirements.
issues.suggested_fix: Define the specific alarm actions (visible and audible) for this condition and differentiate from other alarm triggers.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for methane gas detection and monitoring
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall continuously monitor methane gas concentrations in the wet well using the methane sensor. If methane concentration exceeds 25% of the Lower Explosive Limit (LEL), the system shall immediately activate both visible and audible alarms and inhibit or automatically shut down all pumps until the concentration returns below the safe threshold.
missing_requirements.rationale: Business rules state that hazardous concentrations of flammable gases can exist in the wet well and the system context includes a methane sensor, but no requirement exists for detection, alarm activation, and pump inhibition. This is critical for operator and public safety.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for ventilation system control and monitoring
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall monitor and control the ventilation fan to direct fresh air into the wet well. Upon detection of elevated methane levels or poor air quality, the system shall start the fan within 5 seconds, verify its operation via feedback, detect fan failures and activate alarms if airflow drops below safe levels, and prevent pump operation until adequate ventilation is confirmed.
missing_requirements.rationale: Business rules require fresh air ventilation and system context includes a ventilation fan, but no requirements cover fan control, failure detection, or pump interlocks.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for backup power system integration during power failures
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall automatically switch to the external backup power system upon main power failure, monitor backup power status including battery and fuel levels, and ensure continuous operation of critical functions such as pump control, alarms, and environmental monitoring.
missing_requirements.rationale: System context lists an external backup power system, but no requirements address seamless power transfer, status monitoring, or maintaining critical operations during power outages.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for logging and reporting pump maintenance needs
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall log pump maintenance alerts such as seal failures and overheating events in non-volatile memory, display maintenance notifications on the ControlDisplayPanel, and generate periodic summary reports for maintenance personnel.
missing_requirements.rationale: Although the domain model includes pump condition monitoring, no requirement exists to log maintenance issues or provide actionable reports to maintenance staff for proactive upkeep.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for remote monitoring and override capabilities
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall provide a secure remote interface (e.g., via networked HMI or SCADA link) that allows authenticated and authorized personnel to monitor real-time system status, start and stop pumps, acknowledge alarms, and view logs, with all remote actions audit-logged.
missing_requirements.rationale: Business rules mention remote override support, but no requirement specifies remote access, security controls, or audit logging for remote operations.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for system initialization, shutdown procedures, and pump state management
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall perform defined startup procedures including sensor calibration, pump availability checks based on seal integrity and temperature status, and initialize pumps to an 'available' and 'not running' state. It shall also implement graceful shutdown procedures to safely stop pumps and log shutdown events.
missing_requirements.rationale: Initialization and shutdown are critical for safety and reliability, but no requirements define how system components should be brought online or taken offline in a controlled manner.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for regulatory compliance reporting and long-term data logging
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall record all sensor readings, pump start/stop events, alarms, and user actions with timestamps, store logs in non-volatile memory for at least five years, and generate exportable compliance reports in formats required by regulatory agencies such as EPA and DEP.
missing_requirements.rationale: Regulatory business rules require historical data and audit trails for audits and inspections, but current requirements do not address data retention, reporting formats, or report generation.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for handling dual pump failure scenarios
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall detect when both submersible pumps are unavailable due to failures such as seal failure or overheating, activate visible and audible emergency alarms, and notify public safety authorities or supervisory systems.
missing_requirements.rationale: Worst-case pump failure can lead to sewage overflow and hazards, and the system must respond by alerting operators and authorities to mitigate risks.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for authentication and authorization of manual operations
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall enforce user authentication with role-based access control before permitting local manual override or observational operations. Only users with 'Operator' or 'Maintenance' roles may access manual functions, and all access attempts shall be logged with user identity and timestamp.
missing_requirements.rationale: Business rules mandate only authorized and trained personnel may operate the system manually, but no requirements specify how access control is implemented or audited.

missing_requirements.description: Missing non-functional performance and reliability requirements
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall activate alarms within 2 seconds of detecting hazardous conditions, switch pumps on or off within 5 seconds of liquid level threshold crossings, update sensor readings at least every 1 second, and maintain 99.9% uptime for critical functions.
missing_requirements.rationale: Safety-critical and performance requirements such as response times and availability are not specified but are essential to ensure timely and reliable system operation.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for sensor health diagnostics and fault detection
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall perform periodic self-tests on all sensors including FloatSwitch, LevelSwitch, MoistureSensor, AccessDoorSensor, and MethaneSensor. If a sensor fails or becomes unresponsive, the system shall generate an alarm and notify operators.
missing_requirements.rationale: Undetected sensor failures can result in unsafe operation or incorrect control actions, but no requirements define diagnostic or fault detection mechanisms.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for integration with external systems
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall provide standardized communication interfaces (e.g., using defined protocols) to external systems such as Valve Vault Control System, Sewage Grinder Unit, and Wastewater Treatment Facility to exchange status, control commands, and alarms in real time.
missing_requirements.rationale: System context lists multiple external components, and business rules require interfaces, but current requirements omit integration specifications.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for pump capacity and flow rate specifications
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: Each submersible pump shall have a minimum pumping capacity of [SPECIFIED_RATE] gallons per minute at [SPECIFIED_HEAD] feet of head, and the system shall handle peak flow conditions with one pump operating while ensuring redundancy with both pumps available.
missing_requirements.rationale: Business rules indicate two pumps sized for fixed capacity, but no requirements specify actual performance criteria necessary to meet design flow demands.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for configurable float switch depth thresholds
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall allow authorized users to configure the lead pump activation depth, lag pump activation depth, and high liquid alarm depth via the ControlDisplayPanel, enforce validation rules (e.g., lead depth < lag depth < high alarm depth), and maintain a versioned configuration history.
missing_requirements.rationale: Site-specific depth settings must be configurable and validated, but no requirements define how thresholds are set or constrained.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for pump run time tracking and equalization algorithm
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The PumpControlUnit shall track cumulative run time for each SubmersiblePump and implement a run time equalization algorithm that selects the pump with the lowest accumulated run time for the next operation, preserving run time data across power cycles.
missing_requirements.rationale: Equalizing pump run times and planning maintenance require tracking how long each pump has operated; no requirements define run time attributes or equalization logic.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for alarm acknowledgment and reset functionality
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The control system shall provide an alarm acknowledgment and reset function on the ControlDisplayPanel accessible only to authorized operators, record the operator ID and timestamp when an alarm is acknowledged or cleared, and prevent clearing alarms until hazardous conditions are resolved.
missing_requirements.rationale: Without an acknowledgment and reset mechanism, the system cannot confirm operator response or resume normal operations after an alarm condition.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for pump temperature monitoring and protection
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: Each SubmersiblePump shall include a temperature sensor that monitors motor temperature. If temperature exceeds 85°C, the system shall generate a high temperature alarm; if it reaches 95°C, the system shall automatically shut down the pump to prevent damage.
missing_requirements.rationale: Temperature monitoring is required to detect overheating and protect pump motors, but no detailed requirements specify temperature thresholds or protective actions.

domain_model_issues.description: No class exists to represent a temperature sensor for detecting pump motor overheating, as required by REQ-021 and REQ-024.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Introduce a TemperatureSensor class with methods to read motor temperature and configure thresholds for overheat detection.

domain_model_issues.description: No class exists for monitoring environmental conditions (e.g., gas, humidity) as required by REQ-023.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add an EnvironmentalSensor class (or specialized gas/humidity sensors) and associate it with the WetWellControlSystem.

domain_model_issues.description: No class handles recording and retrieval of real-time and historical operational parameters as required by REQ-025.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Create a DataLogger or HistoryRepository class to store operational data and provide query methods.

domain_model_issues.description: No class or attributes represent individual indicator lights for pump state, seal failure, etc., per REQ-028.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add an IndicatorLight class or extend the Alarm class to model multiple light indicators with distinct types.

domain_model_issues.description: No class models an audible buzzer for issuing audible alerts as referenced in REQ-027.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add a Buzzer class or a subtype of Alarm to represent and manage audible alerts.

domain_model_issues.description: WetWellControlSystem lacks attributes for system state, operational parameters, configuration data, and alarm states, and currently violates the single-responsibility principle by combining too many functions (REQ-001, REQ-010, REQ-011, REQ-012, REQ-023, REQ-025, REQ-027).
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add attributes for system state, operational mode, configuration parameters, operationalParameters, and alarmStates; refactor into subsystems such as SensorManager, AlarmManager, PumpManager, and DisplayManager.

domain_model_issues.description: SubmersiblePump class lacks attributes 'runTime' to track cumulative run time for equalization (REQ-018) and 'pumpId' or 'pumpNumber' to distinguish between lead and lag pumps (REQ-031, REQ-032).
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add 'runTime' attribute and 'pumpId' (or pumpNumber) attribute to each SubmersiblePump instance.

domain_model_issues.description: PumpControlUnit lacks attributes to track individual pump run times and equalization state and is missing methods to record and equalize pump run times as required by REQ-018.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add attributes for tracking each pump's run time and equalization logic state, and implement methods such as 'trackRunTimes' to perform run time tracking and equalization.

domain_model_issues.description: ControlDisplayPanel currently only displays depth; it lacks attributes and methods for presenting pump running state, seal failure, overheat alarms, alarm indicators, and other operational parameters (REQ-003, REQ-025, REQ-028).
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add attributes for pumpState, sealFailureIndicator, overheatIndicator, generalAlarmIndicator, and implement methods to update and render these parameters.

domain_model_issues.description: Alarm class lacks attributes or enumerations to distinguish and track different alarm types (high level, seal failure, overheating, unauthorized entry) and their states, needed for both visible and audible alerts (REQ-004, REQ-017, REQ-027, REQ-028).
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Introduce an 'alarmType' attribute or enum, an 'alarmStates' attribute to store active alarms, and extend existing methods to manage different alarm conditions.

domain_model_issues.description: LevelSwitch and FloatSwitch classes overlap in functionality for depth-based decisions, causing redundancy and confusion (REQ-008, REQ-019).
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Consolidate into a single depth-sensing class or clearly separate roles for LevelSwitch and FloatSwitch, removing duplication.

domain_model_issues.description: LevelSwitch class lacks a 'thresholdDepth' attribute to specify the liquid level at which it triggers pump start, as required by REQ-019.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add a 'thresholdDepth' attribute (e.g., double) and map it to associated pumps.

domain_model_issues.description: The multiplicity for LevelSwitch in the PumpControlUnit->LevelSwitch relationship is '0..*', but at least one LevelSwitch is required for pump control per REQ-019.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Change the multiplicity to '1..*' to enforce that at least one LevelSwitch is always present.

domain_model_issues.description: FloatSwitch class lacks a 'lowPumpDepth' attribute for dry-run protection, an association to pumps with ordering for lead/lag logic, and methods 'activateLeadPump'/'activateLagPump' to implement activation logic, as required by REQ-013, REQ-031, and REQ-032.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add 'lowPumpDepth' attribute, establish an association to specific pumps with an 'order' field, and implement the 'activateLeadPump' and 'activateLagPump' methods.

domain_model_issues.description: FloatSwitch.setAlarmState should trigger Alarm activation, but no association between FloatSwitch and Alarm exists, as required by REQ-017 and REQ-033.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add an association from FloatSwitch to Alarm so that setting an alarm state invokes the appropriate alarm methods.

domain_model_issues.description: PumpControlUnit manages moisture detection notifications but lacks a direct relationship to MoistureSensor, as referenced in REQ-006 and REQ-020.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add an association or event listener relationship between PumpControlUnit and MoistureSensor to receive moisture alerts.

domain_model_issues.description: Each SubmersiblePump must be composed with a TemperatureSensor for motor overheating detection, as required by REQ-021 and REQ-024.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Define a 1:1 composition relationship between SubmersiblePump and TemperatureSensor.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The design of the wet well control system shall provide for the safety and protection of pumping station operators, maintenance personnel, and the public from hazards that may result from its operation.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-001 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SafetyCommittee): The design of the wet well control system shall continuously monitor operational parameters and provide safety and protection for pumping station operators, maintenance personnel, and the public by activating alarms and interlocks when defined hazard thresholds are exceeded. System shall comply with relevant safety standards (specify which) and ensure all hazardous components are properly enclosed or protected. Emergency shutdown procedures shall be available within 5 seconds, and safety documentation shall be provided for all operational procedures. Acceptance Criteria: Alarms activate within 2 seconds of threshold breach; interlocks prevent pump operation beyond safe limits; emergency shutdown initiates within 5 seconds; safety documentation submitted for review. Dependencies: REQ-004, REQ-017.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Adding priority, version, status, source, acceptance criteria, dependencies, and rationale ensures traceability and testability. The requirement lacks specific, testable acceptance criteria that define what constitutes adequate safety and protection; without measurable criteria, compliance cannot be verified.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The control system shall be responsible for monitoring and reporting the level of liquid in the wet well.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-002 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SystemSpec): The control system shall continuously monitor the liquid level in the wet well with an accuracy of ±0.1 ft and report the real-time level reading to the control display panel every 10 seconds. Data shall be available in both digital display and data-log formats, and the system shall detect and report sensor failures within 60 seconds. Acceptance Criteria: Level readings updated within 10 seconds; accuracy within ±0.1 ft; sensor failure alerts delivered within 60 seconds. Dependencies: REQ-026.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying update frequency, accuracy, reporting formats, failure detection criteria, dependencies, and traceability fields improves clarity and testability.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The control system shall be responsible for monitoring and reporting the state of each pump and whether it is currently running or not.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-003 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SystemSpec): The control system shall monitor each submersible pump’s running state by detecting motor current and report Running, Stopped, or Fault to the control display panel within 5 seconds of any change. State changes and detected faults shall be logged for audit. Acceptance Criteria: State changes reflected within 5 seconds; no missed events in 100 consecutive tests; fault conditions distinguished correctly. Dependencies: REQ-028.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Adding timing, acceptance criteria, detection method, dependencies, and rationale ensures verifiability and traceability. Without specific detection and logging criteria, the requirement remains untestable and ambiguous.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The control system shall activate a visual and audible alarm when a hazardous condition exists.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-004 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: AlarmSpec): The control system shall activate visible red LED indicator lights and an audible buzzer (≥85 dB at 1 m) within 2 seconds of detecting any hazardous condition, including pump seal failures, high liquid levels, unauthorized access, or pump overheating. Alarms shall remain active until manually acknowledged. Brightness shall be ≥200 cd. Acceptance Criteria: Activation latency ≤2 seconds; brightness ≥200 cd; sound level ≥85 dB; manual acknowledgment required. Dependencies: REQ-001, REQ-017.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining timing, alarm characteristics (brightness, sound level, LED type), conditions covered, dependencies, and acknowledgment procedures improves testability and compliance.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The control system shall switch each submersible pump on or off in a timely fashion depending on the level of liquid within the wet well.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-005 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: PumpControlSpec): The control system shall switch submersible pumps on or off within 5 seconds of depth thresholds being crossed: start lead pump at 4 ft and lag pump at 6 ft; stop pumps when level drops to 2 ft, maintaining a minimum 1 ft liquid level to prevent dry running. Acceptance Criteria: Pump actions occur within 5 seconds; no conflicting commands; minimum 1 ft maintained. Dependencies: REQ-008, REQ-031, REQ-032.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying exact depth thresholds, timing, dry-run prevention, dependencies, and rationale improves clarity and verifiability. Without these specifics, the term timely fashion is subjective.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Each submersible pump shall be equipped with a moisture sensor that detects the occurrence of an external pump seal failure.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-006 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: HardwareSpec): Each submersible pump shall be equipped with a moisture sensor rated for submersible environments, capable of detecting external seal failures with ≥95% detection rate, binary output indication, and detection within 10 seconds of moisture ingress. False positive rate shall be <1% per year. Acceptance Criteria: Seal failure detected within 10 seconds; detection rate ≥95%; false-alarm rate <1% per year. Dependencies: REQ-020, REQ-030.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying detection performance metrics, binary output, false-alarm rate, timing, environment rating, dependencies, and rationale ensures sensor reliability and verifiability.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Should a seal failure be detected, the pump shall be turned off and an alarm state set.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-007 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: HardwareSpec): If a seal failure is detected, the control system shall shut off the affected pump within 3 seconds and set visible and audible alarms that persist until manual reset. The pump shall not restart until the fault is cleared, and the event shall be logged with timestamp. Additionally, an alternative pump shall start if available. Acceptance Criteria: Pump stops within 3 seconds; alarm active until manual reset; event logged; alternative pump started in 100% of tests. Dependencies: REQ-006, REQ-004.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining reaction time, alarm behavior, restart conditions, logging, fallback pump start, dependencies, and rationale ensures clear and testable response to seal failures.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The float switch (a mercury switch) shall determine the depth of liquid within the wet well and set the on or off state for each pump.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-008 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SensorSpec): The float switch shall measure liquid depth within ±0.1 ft and set each pump’s on/off state based on configurable depth thresholds: start lead pump at 4 ft, lag pump at 6 ft, stop pumps at 2 ft, and trigger high-level alarm at 8 ft. State signals shall update within 2 seconds. Acceptance Criteria: Depth accuracy ±0.1 ft; state change within 2 seconds. Dependencies: REQ-005, REQ-031, REQ-032, REQ-033.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Including depth accuracy, threshold values, timing, dependencies, and traceability fields makes the float switch behavior precise and verifiable.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The access door sensor shall determine the state, opened or closed, of the wet well access door.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-009 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SecuritySpec): The access door sensor shall provide a binary output (Open/Closed) and report state changes within 1 second. The sensor shall be weatherproof, tamper-resistant, and trigger a security alarm after 30 seconds if opened. Acceptance Criteria: Detection latency ≤1 second; no missed events in 100 cycles; false-alarm rate <1 per month. Dependencies: REQ-022, REQ-029.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying detection latency, weatherproofing, tamper resistance, alarm integration, reliability metrics, dependencies, and rationale ensures robust security sensor performance.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The wet well control system shall provide automated operation of the site.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-010 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: ControlSpec): The wet well control system shall automatically operate pumps, alarms, and parameter monitoring based on sensor inputs without human intervention. It shall log all automated actions, resume automatic operation after power restoration, and allow manual override at any time. Acceptance Criteria: Automated mode functions 100% of scheduled cycles over 30 days; operations logged; auto-resume verified after power faults. Dependencies: REQ-002–REQ-009.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining automated functions, logging, power restoration behavior, manual override, dependencies, and clear acceptance criteria ensures the system's automated operation is verifiable and reliable.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The wet well control system shall provide local manual override operation.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-011 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: ControlSpec): The wet well control system shall allow operators at the local panel to manually override all automatic pump and alarm controls. Override controls shall be clearly labeled and protected from accidental activation, with visual indication when in manual mode. Manual commands shall take effect within 2 seconds and disable automatic control until reset, with all override actions logged. Acceptance Criteria: Override available within 2 seconds; manual mode visible; commands logged; automatic mode disabled. Dependencies: REQ-010, REQ-012.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Clarifying which functions are overrideable, labeling, activation timing, visual indicators, logging, dependencies, and rationale enhances safety and auditability of manual operations.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The wet well control system shall provide local observational operation.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-012 (Priority: Low, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: ControlSpec): The system shall allow operators to view real-time and historical sensor and pump data (past 24 hours) on the local display in read-only mode without altering control states. Display shall refresh within 5 seconds, be readable in daylight and low-light, and support intuitive navigation. Acceptance Criteria: Data refresh interval ≤5 seconds; display readability tested under varying light conditions; historical data accessible; read-only mode enforced. Dependencies: REQ-025, REQ-026.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining display features, refresh rates, historical data access, readability, navigation, dependencies, and rationale ensures clear and testable observational operation requirements.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The pump control unit shall start the submersible pump motors to prevent the wet well from running over and stop the pump motors before the wet well runs dry.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-013 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: PumpControlSpec): The pump control unit shall start submersible pump motors when liquid level ≥ lead threshold (4 ft for lead, 6 ft for lag) to prevent overflow and stop motors when level ≤ dry threshold (2 ft) to prevent dry-running, maintaining a minimum 1 ft liquid level. A high-level alarm at 8 ft shall be triggered before overflow. Acceptance Criteria: Pump start/stop actions occur within 5 seconds; thresholds configurable; high-level alarm triggers; minimum level maintained. Dependencies: REQ-031–REQ-033.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying exact level thresholds, timing, alarm triggers, minimum levels, dependencies, and rationale ensures safe operation and testable pump control behavior.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The pump control unit shall keep track of whether or not each motor is running.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-014 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: PumpControlSpec): The pump control unit shall determine motor running state via current sensing, log state with timestamps every 5 seconds, update the control display and alarm system within 5 seconds, and maintain state accuracy >99.9% over 100 cycles. Acceptance Criteria: Logs timestamped; state updates within 5 seconds; false detection rate <0.1%. Dependencies: REQ-025, REQ-028.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Adding detection method, logging frequency, update timing, accuracy metrics, dependencies, and rationale ensures accurate tracking and verifiability of motor states.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The pump control unit shall keep track of whether or not each motor is available to run.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-015 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: PumpControlSpec): The pump control unit shall determine motor availability based on seal failure, overheat, and maintenance lockout; update and log status within 5 seconds; visually flag unavailable motors; prevent unavailable motors from starting; support manual override for maintenance. Acceptance Criteria: Availability updates within 5 seconds; flags accurate in 100 tests; logs timestamped. Dependencies: REQ-006, REQ-020.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying availability criteria, update timing, logging, display behavior, override options, dependencies, and rationale improves operational clarity and testability.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: If a pump motor is not available to run and a request has been made for the pump motor to start, an alternative motor shall be started in its place.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-016 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: PumpControlSpec): If a requested pump motor is unavailable, the control unit shall select an alternative motor based on availability and runtime equalization, start it within 5 seconds, log the substitution, generate an alarm, and notify the operator. If no alternative is available, a high-priority alarm shall be activated. Acceptance Criteria: Alternative motor starts within 5 seconds; substitution logged; alarm and operator notification issued; fallback alarm triggers if no alternative. Dependencies: REQ-015, REQ-014.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining alternative selection criteria, response timing, logging, alarm and notification requirements, dependencies, and rationale ensures continuous operation and clear fault handling.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: An alarm state shall be set when the high water level is reached.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-017 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: AlarmSpec): When liquid depth ≥ 8 ft, the control system shall set the alarm state and activate visible and audible alarms within 2 seconds, remaining active until the level drops below 7 ft. The event shall be logged with a timestamp. Acceptance Criteria: Activation latency ≤2 seconds; alarms persist until level <7 ft; high-water events logged. Dependencies: REQ-004, REQ-033.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying exact threshold, timing, alarm persistence, logging, dependencies, and rationale ensures clear verification of high water alarm behavior.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The pump control unit shall ensure that the starting and stopping of the pump motors equalizes the run times among the motors.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-018 (Priority: Low, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: PumpControlSpec): The pump control unit shall track cumulative run times of all motors, select the motor with the least runtime as lead, and alternate starts such that runtime differences are ≤10% over any 30-day period. The equalization algorithm shall consider motor availability and support manual runtime reset. Acceptance Criteria: Runtime variance ≤10% over 30 days; data maintained and displayed; reset capability available. Dependencies: REQ-014, REQ-015.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining equalization criteria, selection algorithm, data tracking, reset functionality, dependencies, and rationale ensures measurable and maintainable motor usage balancing.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Level switches shall be used to indicate when pump motors should be started.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-019 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SensorSpec): Level switches shall signal the pump control unit when configured thresholds are reached: 4 ft for lead, 6 ft for lag, 8 ft for high-level alarm. Signals shall be delivered within 2 seconds with ≥99% reliability, accuracy ±3 inches, and fail-safe operation. Acceptance Criteria: Signal latency ≤2 seconds; reliability >99% over 100 cycles; accuracy ±3 inches; fail-safe functionality. Dependencies: REQ-008, REQ-031, REQ-032, REQ-033.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying threshold values, signal latency, reliability, accuracy, fail-safe behavior, dependencies, and rationale ensures that level switch indications are reliable and testable.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The pump control unit shall be notified if excess moisture is detected in a pump motor.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-020 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SensorSpec): Upon moisture sensor alarm, the pump control unit shall receive notification within 2 seconds, shut down the affected pump, set its availability status to unavailable, activate a moisture alarm, and log the event with pump ID and timestamp. Acceptance Criteria: Notification latency ≤2 seconds; pump shutdown initiated; availability updated; alarm activated; event logged. Dependencies: REQ-006, REQ-007.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying notification timing, pump shutdown actions, availability status, alarm activation, logging, dependencies, and rationale ensures timely and verifiable response to moisture detection.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The pump control unit shall be notified if a pump motor overheats and shall shut down the overheated motor.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-021 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SensorSpec): If a pump motor temperature exceeds 80 °C (threshold configurable to >85 °C), the control unit shall receive notification within 2 seconds, shut down that motor within 3 seconds, activate an overheat alarm, prevent restart until temperature <70 °C, and start an alternative pump if available. The shutdown event shall be logged. Acceptance Criteria: Notification latency ≤2 seconds; motor shutdown ≤3 seconds; alarm activated; restart prevention enforced; alternative pump started. Dependencies: REQ-024.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining temperature thresholds, shutdown timing, alarm activation, restart conditions, fallback actions, dependencies, and rationale ensures robust protection against motor overheating.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The control system shall monitor the pumping site for unauthorized entry or trespass.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-022 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SecuritySpec): The control system shall continuously monitor access door and perimeter sensors, detect unauthorized entry (e.g., opened door without code) within 2 seconds, trigger a security alarm after a 30-second grace period for authorized entry, and report breaches locally and remotely within 5 seconds. Motion detection shall be supported where applicable, and all events logged. Acceptance Criteria: Detection latency ≤2 seconds; breach report ≤5 seconds; alarm after 30-second delay; false-alarm rate <2%; logs timestamped. Dependencies: REQ-009, REQ-029.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying detection methods, timing, authorized entry handling, remote notification, logging, dependencies, and rationale enhances security monitoring verifiability.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The control system shall monitor the environmental conditions within the wet well.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-023 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: EnvSpec): The control system shall measure temperature (-10 °C to +60 °C, ±2 °C accuracy), humidity, and hazardous gas levels (e.g., H2S, CH4) inside the wet well every 10 minutes, log environmental data hourly, and report values to the display. Alarms shall trigger for out-of-range conditions. Acceptance Criteria: Measurement accuracy ±5% (or ±2 °C for temperature); update interval ≤600 seconds; hourly logging; alarms for parameter breaches. Dependencies: REQ-024, REQ-025.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining sensor ranges, accuracies, measurement intervals, logging schedules, out-of-range alarms, dependencies, and rationale ensures comprehensive environmental monitoring.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The control system shall monitor the physical condition of each pump for the existence of moisture and excessive temperatures.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-024 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: PumpHealthSpec): The control system shall poll each pump’s moisture and temperature sensors every 5 seconds and alert the pump control unit if moisture is detected (sensitivity for seal failure) or temperature exceeds >85 °C (alarm) or >90 °C (shutdown). Faults shall be logged and alarmed immediately, and sensor failures shall trigger alerts. Acceptance Criteria: Polling latency ≤5 seconds; configurable thresholds; moisture detection sensitivity validated; alarms and shutdown executed per thresholds. Dependencies: REQ-020, REQ-021.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Including polling interval, threshold definitions, detection sensitivity, alarm and shutdown criteria, logging, sensor failure alerts, dependencies, and rationale ensures pump condition monitoring is effective and verifiable.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The control system shall record and display real-time and historical operational parameters.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-025 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: ReportingSpec): The control system shall record liquid levels, pump states, alarms, and runtimes every 5 seconds, display real-time and historical data for up to 30 days on the control panel and remote interfaces, and provide data export capability in standard formats. Acceptance Criteria: Data logged every 5 seconds; history retrieval ≤2 seconds; storage ≥30 days; exportable; accessible locally and remotely. Dependencies: REQ-014–REQ-024.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining logging interval, parameter scope, update and retrieval performance, storage duration, export and access interfaces, dependencies, and rationale ensures data availability for diagnostics and auditing.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The control display panel shall have a digital depth of influent measured in feet.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-026 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: DisplaySpec): The control display panel shall show influent liquid depth from 0.0 to 15.0 feet, resolution 0.1 ft, accuracy ±0.1 ft, refresh every 5 seconds, and be readable in daylight and low-light conditions. Acceptance Criteria: Range 0.0–15.0 ft; resolution 0.1 ft; accuracy ±0.1 ft; update interval ≤5 seconds; readability tested. Dependencies: REQ-002, REQ-025.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying display range, resolution, accuracy, refresh rate, readability, dependencies, and rationale ensures reliable operator information.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The control system shall provide an alarm feature that uses both visible indicator lights and an audible buzzer when an alarm state is activated.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-027 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: AlarmSpec): The control system shall activate visible red LED indicators (≥200 cd, visible from 50 feet) and an audible buzzer (85–95 dB at 1 m) within 2 seconds of any alarm state. Alarms shall support manual acknowledgment and silence functions while maintaining visual indication. Acceptance Criteria: Activation latency ≤2 seconds; brightness ≥200 cd; audible level 85–95 dB; manual acknowledgment and silence behavior verified. Dependencies: REQ-004, REQ-017.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Combining performance metrics, activation timing, visibility range, user interaction options, dependencies, and rationale ensures the alarm feature is clear and testable.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Indicator lights shall be provided for pump running state, pump seal failure state, pump high temperature failure state, and high wet well level alarm state.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-028 (Priority: Medium, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: DisplaySpec): The system shall include individual indicator lights for each pump’s running state (green), seal failure (yellow), high-temperature failure (orange), and high liquid level alarm (red), visible from at least 20 feet in daylight. LED indicators shall have >50,000-hour life, be labeled per IEC standards, and reflect system conditions within 5 seconds. Acceptance Criteria: Visibility ≥20 feet; response time ≤5 seconds; LED life >50,000 hours; correct color coding; labeling compliance. Dependencies: REQ-027.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining indicator types, colors, visibility, LED life, labeling standards, response time, dependencies, and rationale ensures consistent and verifiable status visualization.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Monitor and detect prohibited entry to the wet well through the access door by way of a broken electrical circuit. Both audible and visible alarms shall be activated.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-029 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SecuritySpec): The system shall monitor the wet well access door circuit continuously for open-circuit conditions and, upon detection, activate visible and audible alarms (≥85 dB) within 2 seconds, incorporating a 30-second delay for authorized entry code. Events shall be logged with timestamps. Acceptance Criteria: Detection latency ≤2 seconds; delay accommodates entry code; alarm sound ≥85 dB; false-alarm rate <1%; logs recorded. Dependencies: REQ-009, REQ-004.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying detection methods, timing, authorization delay, alarm levels, logging, dependencies, and rationale makes security monitoring of the access door precise and testable.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: Monitor and detect occurrence of a pump motor seal leak. If a leak is detected, both audible and visible alarms shall be activated.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-030 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: HardwareSpec): The system shall continuously monitor moisture sensors on each pump, detect seal leaks within 2 seconds, shut down the affected pump immediately, and activate visible red LED alarms and an 85 dB audible alarm. Events shall be logged with pump ID and timestamp. Acceptance Criteria: Leak detection latency ≤2 seconds; pump shutdown immediate; alarm levels per REQ-004; events logged. Dependencies: REQ-006, REQ-007.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Combining continuous monitoring, detection timing, shutdown actions, alarm specifications, logging, dependencies, and rationale ensures prompt leak response and testability.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: When the depth of liquid is equal to or greater than the lead pump depth, the float switch shall set a state which causes the first pump to turn on.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-031 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SensorSpec): When liquid depth ≥4.0 ft (configurable ±0.2 ft), the float switch shall signal the pump control unit within 2 seconds to turn on Pump 1, start the pump within 10 seconds, log the state change, and apply runtime equalization criteria. Acceptance Criteria: Signal latency ≤2 seconds; pump start ≤10 seconds; threshold accuracy ±0.2 ft; state changes logged. Dependencies: REQ-005, REQ-013.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining threshold values, signal and start timing, logging, equalization criteria, dependencies, and rationale ensures reliable and fair pump activation.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: When the depth of liquid is equal to or greater than the lag pump depth, the float switch shall set a state which causes the second pump to turn on.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-032 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SensorSpec): When liquid depth ≥6.0 ft (configurable ±0.2 ft), the float switch shall signal the pump control unit within 2 seconds to turn on Pump 2, start it within 10 seconds, log the state change, and ensure availability criteria. Acceptance Criteria: Signal latency ≤2 seconds; pump start ≤10 seconds; threshold accuracy ±0.2 ft; state changes logged. Dependencies: REQ-005, REQ-013.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying threshold values, timing, logging, and availability criteria, along with dependencies and rationale, ensures timely and accurate secondary pump activation.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: When the depth of liquid is equal to or greater than the allowable high liquid depth, the float switch shall set an alarm state.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: REQ-033 (Priority: High, Version: 1.0, Status: Draft, Source: SensorSpec): When liquid depth ≥8.0 ft (configurable ±0.2 ft), the float switch shall signal the control system within 2 seconds to set an alarm state and activate visible and audible alarms within 5 seconds. The event shall be logged with a timestamp. Acceptance Criteria: Signal latency ≤2 seconds; alarm activation ≤5 seconds; threshold accuracy ±0.2 ft; visual and audible alarms confirmed; event logged. Dependencies: REQ-017, REQ-004.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining threshold values, timing for signal and alarm activation, alarm types, logging, dependencies, and rationale ensures clear and verifiable high-level alarm behavior.

reasoning.domain_model: I consolidated the three source models by unifying duplicate classes (e.g., merging Pump, PumpMotor into SubmersiblePump) and harmonizing methods (splitting monitor/report into distinct operations). Sensor, switch, display, and alarm classes were standardized across models. I chose composition for owned components (e.g., control system contains pumps, switches, sensors, display, and alarm) and associations for operational relationships (e.g., pump control unit manages pumps and uses level switches, float switch associates with pumps). Where methods or attributes differed, I selected the more detailed or flexible variant (e.g., separate record/display methods, threshold attributes in FloatSwitch). The resulting model provides a complete, conflict-free view with PlantUML specifications reflecting the final structure.
reasoning.analysis:
Analysis aggregated using openai with specialized component processing:
- requirement_completeness: For each requirement, I consolidated the completeness scores from the three analyses, taking the most conservative (lowest) score when any differences existed (though in this case the scores aligned). I combined all missing elements into a union to ensure no deficiency is overlooked. I unified the suggested improvements, drawing the most detailed version (including priority, version, status, source, acceptance criteria, dependencies, and performance metrics) to cover all identified gaps. Rationales were preserved and adapted to explain why each requirement remains incomplete and how the suggested details resolve ambiguities and enhance testability, traceability, and clarity.
- requirement_issues: Aggregated issues from all sources, mapped original issue types to a unified set (Ambiguity→Incomplete, Missing Context/Testability/Implementation→Missing, Conflict→Conflict, Inconsistency→Inconsistency), selected the highest severity when duplicates existed, merged similar descriptions and fixes into consolidated issues, and preserved unique concerns while resolving overlaps and conflicts.
- missing_requirements: All three source analyses provided the same set of 17 missing requirements (MR1 through MR17). I consolidated them into a single list, preserving each unique ID and selecting the most detailed description, suggested requirement text, affected model elements, and rationale from the sources.
- domain_model_issues: We consolidated duplicate issues across sources by grouping on element and issue type, merged overlapping entries to include the most detailed descriptions and suggested fixes, aggregated all relevant requirement references, and promoted severity levels when at least one source indicated MUST FIX. Class-level attribute and method omissions were combined into unified entries per class. Relationship inconsistencies and missing associations were preserved as distinct issues. Novel suggestions like DataLogger, IndicatorLight, Buzzer, and MoistureSensor associations were included. This approach ensures all unique problems from the three analyses are represented with clear fixes and complete requirement coverage.
